main event: Three brothers observed a round, light gray object in the sky over Detroit, Michigan, for about 15-25 minutes on July 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as being about the size of a dime held at arm's length., It had two lights on one side of it., The object moved to the north before disappearing behind clouds., Witnesses concluded it was probably a balloon., The sighting took place during the night under cloudy conditions.
